positive.review:
It's a nice little clicker idle game to pass time with. I turn it on in the morning, as I drink my tea, and eat breakfast. After about 30hrs, I have over half the achievements, so I'm now locked in to get them all.

There does seem to be a slight paywall, but I haven't hit a spot where I feel like I legit can't go further without spending money. I don't spend money on idle or mobile games, so if the paywall gets extreme, I'll have to give up on getting all 1200+ achievements. So far though, it's ok. I just come across moments where it's a move forward every 2-3 days vs the moving forward multiple times in a single day - which is similar to how level grinding works in a stereotypical RPG, the higher the level, the more exp needed, and therefore the longer each level takes to get.

Pretty easy/straightforward game, a bit of active play involved if you want to progress faster.  Ignore the claims of "you can't make progress in Idle/Away mode anymore".  It's just people mad that there's a new (FREE) update, and they lost their precious 100%.  That being said, you can totally 100% it without spending a dime, I'm closing in on the 100% in under 1,000 hours which (to me) is short for an Idle game.    The new Excavation "mini-game" has to have the game opened to use, but that's no different than the base game achievements, such as active catches, chest hunts, etc they had to have the game open and actively doing to achieve.  

You won't be doing a lot of fishing, though.  Mostly you just set up your lil dude and boat in whatever zone is hot for the day, you can hold spacebar to make him fish faster, and outside of special mechanics (active catch, chest hunt, fishing "contest", and Excavation) that's about it.  You "level up" so to speak, spend money on upgrades, bigger boats, more crew to fish for you with their own bonuses, collect pets you can swap in/out with bonuses, etc.  Lots to keep you busy if you want to play active, or you can just check in periodically and spend currencies.  For achievemnt hunters looking for another free to play, slow burn game this is it.
The only good idle/clicker game on the store. If you like the concept of the genre, but always hated the execution then try this one out.
I've never really liked idle games because you max out your supplies easily... but it's free and worth a try!
Interesting and great for killing boredom â€” it offers steady, light progression and doesnâ€™t take up much time in your day, yet itâ€™s enough to keep you entertained.
Just play this game, it's fantastic and  it has great balance!

I've never left a negative review before. And if changes are made ill come back and change this. With the Excavation update this game is no longer Idle, so if you want an idle game this is absolutely not what you're looking for. The Excavation update requires you to not only have the game running in the background but to be actively playing it in order to make any progress and I mean any progress at all. nothing happens with this part of the game unless you're actively playing it, other then you gain some mining points that you spend, you get 40 to start. you will use more then 40 in 1 excavation "map", it takes roughly 200 seconds (3 minutes 20seconds) for you to get this and then you will not gain more unless you buy the first upgrade which lets you up the amount by 10, which buys you another 50 seconds you can "Idle" for. meaning that if you leave the game for lets say 24 hours, in the original idle fishing you get regular idle game benefits, but for this excavation you gain nothing more then you would for being idle for 200 seconds. It's designed for you to spend IRL money on Diamonds with which you can (given enough IRL funds) finish this "mini game" in a matter of hours. otherwise you can expect level 3-4 to take you somewhere around the 8-10 hour mark with it only increasing drastically even just from 4-5 and it goes all the way up to 9

Update December 1st 2025

A lot of good changes have been made to excavation making it more afk which I think matches the purpose of an idle game, I don't mind that excavation takes such an incredible amount of time to complete, that's generally on theme with idle games, however excavation at least to my knowledge have no form of progression unless you have the game open which does feel a little off. I'm swayed enough to change my recommend to a yes but with the caveat that there are still elements that I would still want to see changed.

negative.review:
Excavation update ruined this "idle" game. If changes are made, I will return and alter this review and continue my journey through it. But in its current state, this is not an idle game anymore. Look elsewhere.

EDIT: The newest update has honestly improved things. However, It still feels like the dev took me behind a shed and broke both my legs with a baseball bat compared to how it was before. But at the very least, it is "idleable" again. I still stand by the fact that the expedition update in general shifted the play style of this game, and was not needed in the first place. If I knew a whole new mechanic would be added along your "fishing" game that adds a hundred plus achievements that take weeks of active play, that have NOTHING to do with fishing mind you, I would have never picked this game up in the first place. Now I've got 3k hours in it and I feel like I'm stuck. I still recommend to stay away from this game. I'm not having fun, its just a sunk cost fallacy at this point.

as someone who is very anti ai, the fact that they used artificial incompetence to make the icons instead of having someone draw them (what good devs do) just doesn't sit right with me. i gave it a good honest try, and the core gameplay mechanics are good, and it has that element of making me come back for more, however, i don't think i can recommend it to anyone except for those who want free cheevos. 4.5/10 game.
Was a nice idle game until last update. Now it is a time waste and more a clicker game. Completed it and now this.... Will complete it again, but really... don't even try it!

I enjoyed this game at first but it's totally worn me out. And I say this as someone who plays too many idle games.

Each run, you generate Silver and Gold. Silver is the temporary currency you use to buy fish, skill, and stall upgrades, anything tied to that specific run. These skills are arranged in tiers, and each time you complete a tier, a new one unlocks. The new tier usually has some permanent unlock that goes along with it, so not only does completing tiers help future runs go smoother, but you gain something new which gives you a tiny dopamine hit. Silver always resets when you Ascend so there's no reason to hold onto it.

Gold is bankable. You generate it during the run but you can't touch it until you Ascend. When you Ascend, the game finally gives you the Gold you earned so you can spend it on long term improvements in the Ascension Tree. These include permanent bonuses that are supposed to make future runs stronger, as well as new fishing locations and upgrades to your fishing boat so you can hire more crew members to auto fish for you.

You also earn medals from repeating fishing contests. In theory they're supposed to give you extra bonuses, but in practice they barely make a dent.

The problem is that by Tier 14 of the skills you buy with Silver every run, you get stuck. No matter what you've bought with medals and Gold, you just don't seem to get any closer to finishing Tier 14. I think I've been stuck on Tier 14 for several weeks now. I don't even know how many times I've Ascended. And by this point, when I do Ascend, it doesn't feel like I'm banking enough Gold to get through the absolutely [i]huge[/i] Ascension Tree so I have to save up and do more runs. Each upgrade I buy just feels like a drop in the ocean now. The game becomes sluggish and heavy.

[strike]The dev added an excavation minigame recently that's fully manual, which hasn't been popular since it requires active play in a formerly 100% idle game. I'm a relatively newer player so I'm not as upset about this change as older players are, although I understand their irritation, but I still don't understand what excavating fossils has to do with fishing. So I'm just like, "Mmmkay..."[/strike] (Update: excavation now has an auto feature. I'm sill not sure what excavation has to do with fishing though, and I'm still stuck on tier 14. Lol)

What makes all of this even stranger is how late the game waits to give you a real prestige option. In most idle or incremental games, you get some form of prestige early so you can wipe everything for a stronger permanent boost. In IF, this appears to be the Rebirth feature, which you don't unlock until you finish the entire Ascension Tree. Once you Rebirth, you lose all your Ascension upgrades and start again with the Amber Tree instead, or so I've read. I'm nowhere near Rebirth with almost 60 hours logged. I don't think I'm even halfway there. I can't imagine doing all of this again. I don't trust that the dev has his math right.

[b]TLDR[/b]: Tier 14 kills the fun, I'm not even the only person to bring it up on the forums (dev said it's operating as expected). Progress stalls, Gold upgrades feel useless, and the loop gets stale. I can't help but feel like the developer put some decimals in the wrong place.

Gameplay wise, this game is a fantastic idle clicker game. It's much much better than most for sure. But its just the mind numbingly boring aesthetics that ruin it for me. If I was looking at literally anything more exciting than just a guy sitting in a boat reeling in split second 2D fish all day, I'd play the heck out of this long temr going forward, but since that's what I'm forced to look at for hours of gameplay time on end, sadly I can't recommend this one. If they literally can just make an Idle Fishing 2 with a whole lot more interesting stuff popping up on screen, it would be much better and more playable.

Recent changes have made making any progress unbearably slow and forced me to quit playing after 511 hours.

Avoid this one.

Be warned: this is not an idle game anymore.

This game always had some active play required, but even active catch was possible with autoclicker and seagulls also required quite some time to fill what you can release.

But then the excavation arrived. Why? no clue, this isnt even fishing related, not really related to the main theme of the game. The worst part is however, that you need resources for the excevation, which generates over time. That alone would be fine, but there is a cap how many tools you can own at the same time.

This cap could be increased by talent (owning 60% of all the upgrades for it already) and by pets (owning all 3 pets with all extra tool cap upgrades) and the cap is reached already in less than 5 mins, so you need to check the game and play every 5 minute. Without the upgrades or pets you need to play excavations every minute. GL. For the achievements (which also boost your progress ingame with +% stuffs with each unlocked achievements) you need hell lot of excavations. Offline progress lost its meaning. Very active play required in this "idle" game.

I dont like when a mostly idle game goes into a hardcore active play game, there is my review is negative.

This game is terrible, honestly.  A few others have posted how, once you start playing, you feel like you've invested too much time to not see it through to getting 100% achievements (why else would you play this?).

The game is insanely repetitive, and the achievement grinds are brutal.  The new 'Excavation' update has made this even worse.  What does excavating have to do with fishing?  What a poorly thought out update.  It added, roughly, 500 hours worth of grinding to get all the achievements for it.  This is a common theme.  The developer adds these achievements with insane numbers that make no sense.  Even if he cut the numbers in half, it's still a brutal grind.  I got 100% a month or so ago, and now there's 100+ new achievements (AFTER the developer has stated that he won't be adding more achievements in an effort to prolong the games lifespan).

The lack of transparency about whether a bonus is multiplicative or additive to a particular pool of bonuses is incredibly amateur and annoying.  Please fix, it's so simple.  +20% (+136% >> +156>%) or x20% (+136% >> 163%) or x20% (multiplicative with all other bonuses).

Boat bonus is worst offender.  Buy a new boat and it says "Increase value BY 51,200%" - a simple fix would be to add two words and change another: "Increase boat bonus value to 51,200%" making it clear that this was just doubling from the previous boat.  And not giving us 511x more value.

Otherwise it's a pretty fun idle, with these fixes I would change to recommended.

I enjoyed this game at first but it's totally worn me out. And I say this as someone who plays too many idle games.

Each run, you generate Silver and Gold. Silver is the temporary currency you use to buy fish, skill, and stall upgrades, anything tied to that specific run. These skills are arranged in tiers, and each time you complete a tier, a new one unlocks. The new tier usually has some permanent unlock that goes along with it, so not only does completing tiers help future runs go smoother, but you gain something new which gives you a tiny dopamine hit. Silver always resets when you Ascend so there's no reason to hold onto it.

Gold is bankable. You generate it during the run but you can't touch it until you Ascend. When you Ascend, the game finally gives you the Gold you earned so you can spend it on long term improvements in the Ascension Tree. These include permanent bonuses that are supposed to make future runs stronger, as well as new fishing locations and upgrades to your fishing boat so you can hire more crew members to auto fish for you.

You also earn medals from repeating fishing contests. In theory they're supposed to give you extra bonuses, but in practice they barely make a dent.

The problem is that by Tier 14 of the skills you buy with Silver every run, you get stuck. No matter what you've bought with medals and Gold, you just don't seem to get any closer to finishing Tier 14. I think I've been stuck on Tier 14 for several weeks now. I don't even know how many times I've Ascended. And by this point, when I do Ascend, it doesn't feel like I'm banking enough Gold to get through the absolutely [i]huge[/i] Ascension Tree so I have to save up and do more runs. Each upgrade I buy just feels like a drop in the ocean now. The game becomes sluggish and heavy.

[strike]The dev added an excavation minigame recently that's fully manual, which hasn't been popular since it requires active play in a formerly 100% idle game. I'm a relatively newer player so I'm not as upset about this change as older players are, although I understand their irritation, but I still don't understand what excavating fossils has to do with fishing. So I'm just like, "Mmmkay..."[/strike] (Update: excavation now has an auto feature. I'm sill not sure what excavation has to do with fishing though, and I'm still stuck on tier 14. Lol)

What makes all of this even stranger is how late the game waits to give you a real prestige option. In most idle or incremental games, you get some form of prestige early so you can wipe everything for a stronger permanent boost. In IF, this appears to be the Rebirth feature, which you don't unlock until you finish the entire Ascension Tree. Once you Rebirth, you lose all your Ascension upgrades and start again with the Amber Tree instead, or so I've read. I'm nowhere near Rebirth with almost 60 hours logged. I don't think I'm even halfway there. I can't imagine doing all of this again. I don't trust that the dev has his math right.

[b]TLDR[/b]: Tier 14 kills the fun, I'm not even the only person to bring it up on the forums (dev said it's operating as expected). Progress stalls, Gold upgrades feel useless, and the loop gets stale. I can't help but feel like the developer put some decimals in the wrong place.

not an idle game, uses ai, has terrible pacing, doesn't tell you what is multiplicative or additive.

While I give the dev credit for listening to feedback, it's clear they're only willing to half-listen in order to push some sort of agenda that I can't quite fathom. As a developer, there must be some incentive to having your steam game open and lots of hours played or something, because that's the only thing that's happening with excavation and all the updates after. 
You could get 99 agility in Runescape in less clicks and less time than it would take to get the achievements related to the amount of pickaxes needed. 

People defend this as a "slow-burn" idle game. This game is not idle when you include excavation, and the updates are always making it less idle. There is actually an idle mode for excavation now, and it punishes you for using it. There isn't a 'boost' to your resources for being active, there's a nerf to them for being idle. Oh, and it uses twice the number of pickaxes to utilize this 'smart' idle mode. 

Dev has lost sight of the grand picture. Achievement hunters aren't complaining because an achievement will take some time to get, it's because it's ludicrous to say "Give me 200,000 clicks, but you can only click 500 times every half hour".  200 hours just to get the chisels done - and that's if you have all the pets upgraded like me and already worked through all the awful excavation upgrades. So a new player? Good luck! 

If you are new and looking at this game - save yourself the trouble of a dev that's just trying to add content for the sake of putting you on the hamster wheel. Did I mention that post got deleted from the forums? The dev said they would never add achievements just to keep the wheel spinning, but yet, here we are, with that post deleted. Very interesting...

The lack of transparency about whether a bonus is multiplicative or additive to a particular pool of bonuses is incredibly amateur and annoying.  Please fix, it's so simple.  +20% (+136% >> +156>%) or x20% (+136% >> 163%) or x20% (multiplicative with all other bonuses).

Boat bonus is worst offender.  Buy a new boat and it says "Increase value BY 51,200%" - a simple fix would be to add two words and change another: "Increase boat bonus value to 51,200%" making it clear that this was just doubling from the previous boat.  And not giving us 511x more value.

Otherwise it's a pretty fun idle, with these fixes I would change to recommended.

Be warned: this is not an idle game anymore.

This game always had some active play required, but even active catch was possible with autoclicker and seagulls also required quite some time to fill what you can release.

But then the excavation arrived. Why? no clue, this isnt even fishing related, not really related to the main theme of the game. The worst part is however, that you need resources for the excevation, which generates over time. That alone would be fine, but there is a cap how many tools you can own at the same time.

This cap could be increased by talent (owning 60% of all the upgrades for it already) and by pets (owning all 3 pets with all extra tool cap upgrades) and the cap is reached already in less than 5 mins, so you need to check the game and play every 5 minute. Without the upgrades or pets you need to play excavations every minute. GL. For the achievements (which also boost your progress ingame with +% stuffs with each unlocked achievements) you need hell lot of excavations. Offline progress lost its meaning. Very active play required in this "idle" game.

The lack of transparency about whether a bonus is multiplicative or additive to a particular pool of bonuses is incredibly amateur and annoying.  Please fix, it's so simple.  +20% (+136% >> +156>%) or x20% (+136% >> 163%) or x20% (multiplicative with all other bonuses).

Boat bonus is worst offender.  Buy a new boat and it says "Increase value BY 51,200%" - a simple fix would be to add two words and change another: "Increase boat bonus value to 51,200%" making it clear that this was just doubling from the previous boat.  And not giving us 511x more value.

Otherwise it's a pretty fun idle, with these fixes I would change to recommended.

I enjoyed this game at first but it's totally worn me out. And I say this as someone who plays too many idle games.

Each run, you generate Silver and Gold. Silver is the temporary currency you use to buy fish, skill, and stall upgrades, anything tied to that specific run. These skills are arranged in tiers, and each time you complete a tier, a new one unlocks. The new tier usually has some permanent unlock that goes along with it, so not only does completing tiers help future runs go smoother, but you gain something new which gives you a tiny dopamine hit. Silver always resets when you Ascend so there's no reason to hold onto it.

Gold is bankable. You generate it during the run but you can't touch it until you Ascend. When you Ascend, the game finally gives you the Gold you earned so you can spend it on long term improvements in the Ascension Tree. These include permanent bonuses that are supposed to make future runs stronger, as well as new fishing locations and upgrades to your fishing boat so you can hire more crew members to auto fish for you.

You also earn medals from repeating fishing contests. In theory they're supposed to give you extra bonuses, but in practice they barely make a dent.

The problem is that by Tier 14 of the skills you buy with Silver every run, you get stuck. No matter what you've bought with medals and Gold, you just don't seem to get any closer to finishing Tier 14. I think I've been stuck on Tier 14 for several weeks now. I don't even know how many times I've Ascended. And by this point, when I do Ascend, it doesn't feel like I'm banking enough Gold to get through the absolutely [i]huge[/i] Ascension Tree so I have to save up and do more runs. Each upgrade I buy just feels like a drop in the ocean now. The game becomes sluggish and heavy.

[strike]The dev added an excavation minigame recently that's fully manual, which hasn't been popular since it requires active play in a formerly 100% idle game. I'm a relatively newer player so I'm not as upset about this change as older players are, although I understand their irritation, but I still don't understand what excavating fossils has to do with fishing. So I'm just like, "Mmmkay..."[/strike] (Update: excavation now has an auto feature. I'm sill not sure what excavation has to do with fishing though, and I'm still stuck on tier 14. Lol)

What makes all of this even stranger is how late the game waits to give you a real prestige option. In most idle or incremental games, you get some form of prestige early so you can wipe everything for a stronger permanent boost. In IF, this appears to be the Rebirth feature, which you don't unlock until you finish the entire Ascension Tree. Once you Rebirth, you lose all your Ascension upgrades and start again with the Amber Tree instead, or so I've read. I'm nowhere near Rebirth with almost 60 hours logged. I don't think I'm even halfway there. I can't imagine doing all of this again. I don't trust that the dev has his math right.

[b]TLDR[/b]: Tier 14 kills the fun, I'm not even the only person to bring it up on the forums (dev said it's operating as expected). Progress stalls, Gold upgrades feel useless, and the loop gets stale. I can't help but feel like the developer put some decimals in the wrong place.

While I give the dev credit for listening to feedback, it's clear they're only willing to half-listen in order to push some sort of agenda that I can't quite fathom. As a developer, there must be some incentive to having your steam game open and lots of hours played or something, because that's the only thing that's happening with excavation and all the updates after. 
You could get 99 agility in Runescape in less clicks and less time than it would take to get the achievements related to the amount of pickaxes needed. 

People defend this as a "slow-burn" idle game. This game is not idle when you include excavation, and the updates are always making it less idle. There is actually an idle mode for excavation now, and it punishes you for using it. There isn't a 'boost' to your resources for being active, there's a nerf to them for being idle. Oh, and it uses twice the number of pickaxes to utilize this 'smart' idle mode. 

Dev has lost sight of the grand picture. Achievement hunters aren't complaining because an achievement will take some time to get, it's because it's ludicrous to say "Give me 200,000 clicks, but you can only click 500 times every half hour".  200 hours just to get the chisels done - and that's if you have all the pets upgraded like me and already worked through all the awful excavation upgrades. So a new player? Good luck! 

If you are new and looking at this game - save yourself the trouble of a dev that's just trying to add content for the sake of putting you on the hamster wheel. Did I mention that post got deleted from the forums? The dev said they would never add achievements just to keep the wheel spinning, but yet, here we are, with that post deleted. Very interesting...

The bank for the resources is way to small, it starts at 100, where you generate 1 pickaxe every 10 seconds, which means you have a full bank in about 16 minutes. It's not too hard to start making the pickaxes generate faster, and even upgrade your bank with it. To bring the time down to something like 10 minutes for a full bank. This means that in order to have any semblance of progress, you have to be clicking on this game every 10 minutes. If you have saved up gems to buy some boosts, it's even less time than that.
